result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy S Appleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
If revoked: Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Probation may be transferred to the State of Pennsylvania if accepted

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with the victim Jane G. or her residence.
Provide DNA sample of not previously done

Case 15CM1178 was dismissed and read into: 14CF1113, and 15CF144.

Restitution to be determined on 2/08/2016 at 11:00 AM.

AS OF 4/18/16: Restitution of $250.00 was added for the Insurance deductible. (along with surcharges) To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - 1st 5 months are STRAIGHT TIME, 3 months with Huber and the last 3 are STAYED-to be used at Agent's discretion.
Court grants 51 days credit.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jeremy S Appleton in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Victim presents statements to the court. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE of: 

 6 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

and placed on PROBATION FOR 3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  the victim Jane G. or her residence
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  To be determined

FINE or COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:  11 MONTHS JAIL, 1ST 5 MONTHS ARE STRAIGHT TIME, 3 MONTHS WITH HUBER AND THE LAST 3 MONTHS ARE STAYED AND TO BE USED AT THE AGENT'S DISGRETION. (51 days credit)

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

PROBATION MAYBE TRANSFERRED TO THE STATE OF PA IF ACCEPTED

  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.
